text:
Baseline

Assumes that current public policies, business practices, and individual behaviors continue.

Reduce fees

DYNASIM subtracts one percentage point from both stock and bond returns for administrative fees. This simulation lowers the fee to 0.5 percentage points for both stock and bonds.

Rebalance every 5 years

Rebalance stock and bond allocations every five years instead of every year.

Low participation

Decrease the calculated probability of worker contributions, conditional on having an offer by 15 percent: multiply the baseline predicted probability by 0.85.

High participation

Increase the calculated probability of worker contributions, conditional on having an offer by 15 percent: multiply the baseline predicted probability by 1.15.

Less risk

The low risk scenario has workers invest in the least aggressive (lowest share in stocks) among DYNASIM’s 41 target date funds (PIMCO RealRetirement Series).

More risk

The high-risk scenario has all workers invest in the most aggressive (highest share in stocks) among DYNASIM’s 41 target date funds (Guidestone Funds MyDestination Series).

No target date funds

Eliminate the option to invest in target date funds.

No auto-enrollment

Remove the boost in participation probability for workers in firms with automatic enrollment.

No cash outs

Don’t let workers take early distributions (cash out) from DC or Roth savings.

All Roth-401k accounts #1

Invest year 2014 after-tax DC contributions to a Roth 401k account, then use baseline pension assumptions after 2014. Examine the net present value of tax lifetime taxes and retirement savings.

All Roth-401k accounts #2

Beginning in 2014, invest all pre-tax DC contributions to a ROTH-401k account. Examine the net present value of tax lifetime taxes and retirement savings. This option assumes workers reduce total annual consumption to offset the additional income taxes on ROTH contributions that are not tax deferred.

Mandated employer plans (60%)

Mandates Roth IRA plans for all firms with 10 or more workers. The plans have automatic enrollment, 3% default investments in target date funds, and Roth AGI limits. 60% of participants use default settings.

Mandated employer plans (100%)

Mandates Roth IRA plans for all firms with 10 or more workers. The plans have automatic enrollment, 3% default investments in target date funds, and Roth AGI limits. 60% of participants use default settings. Mandated employer plan candidates are forced to participate and cash outs are eliminated.
